result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitch Allen Carufel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mitch Allen Carufel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mitch Allen Carufel was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Unpaid court costs.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:

No contact with Bill Murphy.
Follow any conditions the agent deems necessary.
Would like the Agent to look at having the Defendant attend Restorative Justice.
Would like the Agent to require a sincere apology from the Defendant to the victim.
If the Agent feels it is appropriate at any time he/she may lift the no contact with Mr. Murphy.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction and Judgment of dismissal.  Not Deliverable as addressed.
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

8:42  Defendant Mitch Allen Carufel in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Defendant Mitch Allen Carufel in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich - Ct 1 dismiss  Ct 2 Plead to disorderly conduct  Probation 1 year  No contact with victim BM  No additional jail time.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 2 of the complaint.    Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 2 of the criminal complaint and dismisses Ct 1.  Court orders S/W Probation 1 year. Conditions: Court costs , DNA sample and surcharge   NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM BILL MURPHY. Whatever conditions the agent deems necessary. The court would like the agent to require a sincere apology from the defendant to the victim . Also would like the agent to look at having the defendant attend restorative justice. If the agent feels it is appropiate at any time he/she may lift the no contact with Mr. Murphy. Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

ADA William H. Thorie appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mitch Allen Carufel appears via videoconferencing from Pierce County Jail with Attorney Christopher R. Bub in Court.  Case called at 4:14 p.m.  Court advises Defendant of charges and possible penalties, Defendant waives further reading.  Court advises of rights, Defendant understands.  Atty. Bub enters NG pleas on both counts.  State requests $3,000 signature bond and notes Defendant is on PO hold.  Defendant objects to signature bond and requests cash bond so he gets credit for being in jail.  States PO hold is from St. Croix Co.  Atty. Bub questions Defendant.  Court orders $3,000 signature bond.  Court sets for PTC.  Atty. Bub states PD's office will be involved.  Court advises Defendant of bond conditions.  Court questions address.  Defendant states he cannot return to address in Ellsworth.  Court states that additional condition of bond will be that he provides mailing address.  Court questions military service, non-military.  Defendant questions charges, Court advises.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
